member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext
member.summary: Describes the context in which an authorization is being performed.
member.remarks:
This class contains information describing the instance and the operation being authorized. It implements and must be properly disposed after use.
It supports so that custom validation code can acquire additional services to help it perform its validation.
An property bag is available for additional contextual information about the authorization. Values stored in will be available to authorization methods that use this
This class also provides an implementation to allow developers to add services to the context at runtime. This container is available via specifying typeof(IServiceContainer) or via the property.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.#ctor(System.IServiceProvider)
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class that can be used as a template.
member.remarks:
This form of the contructor creates only a template which cannot be used directly in authorization requests.
A template is one which has been configured with a set of services and the developer wants to use for authorization requests. It cannot be used directly during authorization, but an alternate form of the constructor allows other instances to clone that template's state.
The property allows such a template to be set into the for all authorization requests.
member.param: Optional parent to which calls to can be delegated.

member.name: M:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.#ctor(System.Object,System.String,System.String,System.IServiceProvider,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.Object,System.Object})
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class that can be used for authorization.
member.param: Optional object instance.
Name of the operation requiring authorization, such as "GetEmployees".
Kind of the operation requiring authorization, such as "Query".
Optional to use when is called.

Optional set of key/value pairs to make available to consumers via . If null, an empty dictionary will be created. If not null, the set of key/value pairs will be copied into a new dictionary, preventing consumers from modifying the original dictionary.
member.exception: When or is null or empty.

An existing to use as a template.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.ServiceContainer
member.summary: Gets a that can be used for adding, removing, and getting services used for authorization. will query into this container as well as the specified in the constructor.
member.value: This container will be created only on demand and is effectively scoped to this instance. It will not promote add or remove requests.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.Instance
member.summary: Gets the object instance being authorized.
member.value:
This value may be null in situations where no object instance is available, such as when authorizing queries or evaluating whether an operation can be attempted.
Subclasses of that depend on this value to perform instance-level authorization should check for null, and if everything else is acceptable, they should allow the authorization request.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.Items
member.summary: Gets the dictionary of key/value pairs associated with this context.
member.value: This property will never return null, but the dictionary may be empty. Changes made to items in this dictionary will never affect the original dictionary specified in the constructor.

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.Operation
member.summary: Gets the name of the operation being authorized.
member.value: This value will never be null or empty. It reflects the developer's operation name, such as "GetEmployees".

member.name: P:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationContext.OperationType
member.summary: Gets the kind of the operation being authorized.
member.value: This value will never be null or empty. It reflects the category of the operation being authorized. Example values are "Query" and "Invoke".

member.name: T:System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.AuthorizationResult
member.summary: Container class for the results of a authorization request.
member.remarks:
See for details regarding the usage of this class.
Use the static to represent successful authorization. Any other non-null instance of this class is considered to be a denial of an authorization request.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.MemberProjectionPropertyDescriptor.Attributes
member.summary: We must override Attributes and compute them dynamically to get around TD registration ordering issues for projection include members. The issue is that it might be the case that custom TDs havent been registered yet for the target property at the point in time when the projection property is created. That would mean that all attributes aren't yet known when the projection property descriptor is created, so the attributes can't be set at construction time.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription.FixupCompositionMap
member.summary: Fixes the map of composed types so that derived composition types inherit the parent associations from their base type.
member.remarks: This method assumes the composition map has been constructed to contain the parent associations for each composed type without regard to inheritance. Hence, composition subclasses will not have entries in the map unless they have additional parent associations. Composition subclasses that have no entry will gain a new entry that is the accumulation of all their base class's associations. Composition subclasses that have their own parent associations will combine those with the accumulated base class's associations.

member.name: M:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription.FixParentAssociationsWalk(System.Type,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{System.Type})
member.summary: Helper method to ensure this 's entry in the composition map combines its explicit parent associations together with those from all its base type's associations.
member.remarks: This algorithm repairs the composition map in-place and reentrantly fixes the entity's base class entries first. The map will not be replaced, but will be updated in-place. Existing lists in the map will be extended but not replaced. Holes in the map will be filled in by sharing the base class's entry rather than cloning.
member.param: The entity type to repair. It may or may not be a composed type.
Hash of already repaired entity types. Used to avoid duplicate fixups.
member.returns: The collection of parent associations.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.DomainServiceDescription.EntityKnownTypes
member.summary: Gets the cache associating entity types with the types identified with
member.value: The result is a dictionary, keyed by entity type and containing the set of other entity types that were declared via a . This set contains only entity types -- extraneous other known types are omitted. This set also contains the full closure of known types for every entity type by rolling up derived type's known types onto their base. This cache is lazily loaded but stable. This means that we capture the list of known types once and are not affected by the semantics of that permit a runtime method to return potentially different known types.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.ApplicationServices.AuthenticationBase`1
member.summary: that encapsulates the authentication domain.
member.remarks:
The default AuthenticationService on the client will work with the DomainContext generated for any domain service extending this class.
is designed as an update method, and will be invoked via SubmitChanges on the client. This has a couple implications. First, invoking via AuthenticationService.SaveUser will submit all changes that have occurred in the DomainContext and may invoke other update methods. Second, invoking other update methods on the DomainContext from the client will submit all changes and may invoke .
By default, this domain service relies on the ASP.NET providers for Membership, Roles, and Profile and will reflect the customizations made in each.
member.typeparam: The type of the user entity

System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Client.ApplicationServices.WebAuthenticationService will work with the DomainContext generated for any domain service implementing this interface.
is designed as an update method, and will be invoked via SubmitChanges on the client. This has a couple implications. member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.DomainServices.Server.ApplicationServices.ProfileUsageAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that describes how a property is backed in an ASP.NET profile. It can be used with user entities extending .
member.remarks: This attribute is used by the to determine how it should read from or write to the ASP.NET profile that backs the data. If a property is in the profile with the same name, then this attribute does not need to be used. If a property is not in the profile then should be set to true. If a property has been named differently than the profile value that backs it, then should be set to the name of the backing value in the profile.
